intro: Navarretia purpurea, commonly known as the purple navarretia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with distinctive four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly habitats, often in open areas with full sun exposure. Its showy, violet-colored flowers bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Navarretia purpurea is known for its delicate appearance and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions.
